Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Neoadjuvant PD-1 Blockade Plus Chemoradiotherapy in Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were divided into a combined group receiving PD-1 blockade plus chemoradiotherapy and a non-combined group receiving PD-1 blockade plus chemotherapy.

Participants.evidence: PDAC patients undergoing resection after neoadjuvant treatment (NAT).

Intervention.evidence: Participants were divided into a combined group receiving PD-1 blockade plus chemoradiotherapy and a non-combined group receiving PD-1 blockade plus chemotherapy.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the effects of neoadjuvant PD-1 blockade plus chemoradiotherapy on pathological response (PR) and survival in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was complete pathological response (CPR), assessed using the CAP and MDACC systems.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 47 patients were enrolled, with 26 in the combined group and 21 in the non-combined group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 47 patients were enrolled, with 26 in the combined group and 21 in the non-combined group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: CPR was achieved in 6 patients (23.1%) in the combined group and none in the non-combined group.
